page.title: 04Blean woods
page.content: Our area is three-quarters covered by woodland of a mixed variety. Oak, fir,beech,hornbeam,hazel,elm,ash wild service,hawthorne and sweet chestnut abound. The trees are managed in two ways; coppicing and clearance with planting. Ground cover is plentiful with mainly fern under the tree canopy and wood- land plants along the paths. The area is undulating with some small streams running away from the hills cutting fairly deep gullies in places. The woods are traversed by several footpaths varying from wide swathes to narrow trails which are often reclaimed by nature. Part of Church Wood is a Nature Resverve and the R.S.P.B. has a designated area.
